Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the existence of an "open borders bill" that every single Democrat in the U.S. Senate has signed up for.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the intention of the bill introduced by Sen. Dianne Feinstein is to create open borders, when in fact it is aimed at preventing the separation of immigrant families.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support for the existence of an "open borders bill" signed by every Democrat in the U.S. Senate.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no "open borders bill" and misrepresents the intention of the actual bill introduced by Sen. Feinstein.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the alternative explanation that the bill introduced by Sen. Feinstein is focused on preventing family separations and not promoting open borders.
